item.title: A love letter to the Internet
item.description: Dear Internet, I’ve never written to you on this special day before, so I thought I’d give you a surprise this time! After all, we’ve been through a lot together, since our first encounter over a dial-up connection in the early two thousands. I was late to the party, I know, but it’s not my fault to have been born in the early nineties! Some people say you are slowly dying.

item.title: Build Your Own Ubuntu with Cubic | Just Vincredible
item.description: I’ve been wanting to make my own Linux distro for some time now and, well, I hadn’t developed the proper skills needed to follow through on such an abundant task. The process of building a Linux Distribution can be pretty tough and making a quality and usable product is another argument entirely. With some aggressive google searching, I was able to find a list of the best Linux distro building kits. Before you start building any distros it may be a good idea to look into how KVM works and learn the models behind the Linux Kernel Architecture. Moving on, I happened to stumble upon a decent and easy-to-use Ubuntu ISO Creator. This app gives you the ability to reconcile your settings and updates before the disk has been created. Let’s take a closer look at what building a Ubuntu distro was like, using Cubic. You’re going to need a Linux machine and for this lab, so I’ll be firing up a virtual machine and allocating the necessary RAM and Processing speed to create an ISO image. You will also need a blank ISO to build your custom distro with, I downloaded a bare-bones Xubuntu ISO here. The keys and installation methods:

item.description: The European Court of Human Rights yesterday banned a general weakeningof secure end-to-end encryption. The judgement argues that encryptionhelps citizens and companies to protect themselves against hacking,theft of identity and personal data, fraud and the unauthoriseddisclosure of confidential information.
